channel.title: Assembly on Sad Robot
channel.description: Recent content in Assembly on Sad Robot

item.title: Could not load file or assembly â€˜xâ€™ or one of its dependencies. Strong name validation failed.
item.description: In some of the work I’m doing right now, I’m manipulating an assembly after compile time - having it disassembled into IL, tweaked, then re-compiled back into an assembly. The assembly is signed and what is being done to the assembly is breaking the strong name. This is quite comforting to know; the strong name wouldn’t be so strong if it was that easy to hack an assembly with a strong name.

item.title: Configuring NLog for your application when NLog is in the Global Assembly Cache (GAC)
item.description: If you have several applications that are using NLog, it can be a good idea to install NLog into the GAC and reference that. A gotcha you must watch out for is caused by this piece of configuration from the NLog site: Because you are not using the strong name for the Assembly-qualified name of ConfigSectionHandler, it’s impossible to do a GAC lookup, therefore NLog won’t be found and you’ll get an application error (even if NLog is actually in the GAC).
